original: Engberg, Karl Gunnar, varvsdirektör, Göteborg, f. 28/1/84 i Norrköp. av tulluppsyn :man Adolf E. o. Hanna Lager. G. 45 m. grevran Maud von Rosen. — Norrköp. te’kn. elem:sk. 01, Chalmers skeppsbygg :kurs 04, stud. skeppsbygg, i Engl., Tyskl. o. Amerika 05-07. Res. t. Engl., Tyskl., Norge, Danm. o. USA. Varvsing. v. Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst. A-B i Gbg 07-17, verkst. dir. där sed. 17. Led. av styr. f. Sv res allm. exp:fören., Sv:es ind:-förb., A-B. Gbgs Hand:bank o. Sv:es Allm. Sjöförsäkr. A-B. Hobby: segling. KV02kl, RNO, KFinlVRO, KNS:.tOO, RDDO, PatrGM, HedLÖS.
translated: Engberg, Karl Gunnar, shipyard director, Gothenburg, born January 28, 1884 in Norrköping, son of customs inspector Adolf E. and Hanna Lager. Married in 1945 to Countess Maud von Rosen. Attended technical school in Norrköping in 1901, Chalmers shipbuilding course in 1904, and studied shipbuilding in England, Germany, and America from 1905-1907. Traveled to England, Germany, Norway, Denmark, and the USA. Worked as a shipyard engineer at Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst. A-B in Gothenburg from 1907-1917 and was appointed as their managing director in 1917. He was a member of the board of Svenska Resenärernas Allmänna Exploateringsförening, Svenska Industriförbundet, Gbg's Handelsbank, and Svenska Allmänna Sjöförsäkrings A-B. His hobbies included sailing. He received the Royal Order of the Sword of the 2nd Class, the Royal Norwegian Order, the Finnish Order of the Lion Knight 1st Class, the Royal Swedish Yacht Club's Gold Medal, the 1914 Red Cross Medal, the Patriotic Society's Grand Medal, and the Swedish Red Cross' Medal of Merit.

education.credentialAwarded: Shipbuilding studies in England, Germany, and America
